014package org.microbean.assign;
015
016import java.lang.constant.ClassDesc;
017import java.lang.constant.Constable;
018import java.lang.constant.ConstantDesc;
019import java.lang.constant.DynamicConstantDesc;
020import java.lang.constant.MethodHandleDesc;
021
022import java.util.ArrayList;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.Comparator;
025import java.util.List;
026import java.util.Objects;
027import java.util.Optional;
028import java.util.Set;
029import java.util.StringJoiner;
030
031import java.util.function.Predicate;
032
033import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
034import javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind;
035import javax.lang.model.element.Parameterizable;
036import javax.lang.model.element.QualifiedNameable;
037
038import javax.lang.model.type.ArrayType;
039import javax.lang.model.type.DeclaredType;
040import javax.lang.model.type.IntersectionType;
041import javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind;
042import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
043import javax.lang.model.type.TypeVariable;
044import javax.lang.model.type.WildcardType;
045
046import org.microbean.construct.Domain;
047
048import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.BSM_INVOKE;
049
050import static java.util.HashSet.newHashSet;
051
052import static java.util.stream.Stream.concat;
053
054/**
055 * A utility class that assists with working with a {@link Domain} instance.
056 *
057 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
058 *
059 * @see #supertypes(TypeMirror, Predicate)
060 *
061 * @see Domain
062 */
063public class Types implements Constable {
064
065
066  /*
067   * Static fields.
068   */
069
070
071  private static final ClassDesc CD_Domain = ClassDesc.of("org.microbean.construct.Domain");
072
073
074  /*
075   * Instance fields.
076   */
077
078
079  private final Comparator<TypeMirror> c;
080
081  private final Domain domain;
082
083
084  /*
085   * Constructors.
086   */
087
088
089  /**
090   * Creates a new {@link Types}.
091   *
092   * @param domain a {@link Domain}; must not be {@code null}
093   *
094   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code domain} is {@code null}
095   */
096  public Types(final Domain domain) {
097    super();
098    this.domain = Objects.requireNonNull(domain, "domain");
099    this.c = new SpecializationComparator();
100  }
101
102
103  /*
104   * Instance methods.
105   */
106
107
108  /**
109   * Returns an {@link Optional} housing a {@link ConstantDesc} that represents this {@link Types}.
110   *
111   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.</p>
112   *
113   * <p>The default implementation of this method relies on the presence of a {@code public} constructor that accepts a
114   * single {@link Domain}-typed argument.</p>
115   *
116   * <p>The {@link Optional} returned by an invocation of this method may be, and often will be, {@linkplain
117   * Optional#isEmpty() empty}.</p>
118   *
119   * @return an {@link Optional} housing a {@link ConstantDesc} that represents this {@link Types}; never {@code null}
120   *
121   * @see Constable#describeConstable()
122   */
123  @Override // Constable
124  public Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
125    return (this.domain instanceof Constable c ? c.describeConstable() : Optional.<ConstantDesc>empty())
126      .map(domainDesc -> DynamicConstantDesc.of(BSM_INVOKE,
127                                                MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(ClassDesc.of(this.getClass().getName()),
128                                                                               CD_Domain),
129                                                domainDesc));
130  }
131
132  /**
133   * Returns the {@link Domain} affiliated with this {@link Types} instance.
134   *
135   * @return the {@link Domain} affiliated with this {@link Types} instance; never {@code null}
136   */
137  public final Domain domain() {
138    return this.domain;
139  }
140
141  /**
142   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to this {@link Types}.
143   *
144   * <p>The supplied {@link Object} is considered to be equal to this {@link Types} if and only if {@linkplain
145   * Object#getClass() its class} is that of this {@link Types}, and if the return value of an invocation of this {@link
146   * Types}' {@link #domain() domain()} method {@linkplain Object#equals(Object) is equal to} the {@link Domain}
147   * returned by an invocation of the other {@link Types}' {@link #domain() domain()} method.</p>
148   *
149   * @param other an {@link Object}; may be {@code null}
150   *
151   * @return {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to this {@link Types}
152   *
153   * @see #domain()
154   */
155  @Override // Object
156  public boolean equals(final Object other) {
157    if (other == this) {
158      return true;
159    } else if (other != null && other.getClass() == this.getClass()) {
160      return this.domain().equals(((Types)other).domain());
161    } else {
162      return false;
163    }
164  }
165
166  /**
167   * Returns a hashcode for this {@link Types} based solely on {@linkplain #domain() its <code>Domain</code>}.
168   *
169   * @return a hashcode for this {@link Types}
170   */
171  @Override // Object
172  public int hashCode() {
173    return this.domain().hashCode();
174  }
175
176  private final boolean isInterface(final Element e) {
177    return e.getKind().isInterface();
178  }
179
180  private final boolean isInterface(final TypeMirror t) {
181    return t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED && isInterface(((DeclaredType)t).asElement());
182  }
183
184  /**
185   * Returns a non-{@code null}, immutable {@link List} of the supertypes of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}.
186   *
187   * <p>No element in the returned {@link List} will be {@code null}.</p>
188   *
189   * <p>The supplied {@link TypeMirror} will be the first element in the returned {@link List}. (The supertype relation
190   * is reflexive.)</p>
191   *
192   * <p>No two elements in the list will be {@linkplain Objects#equals(Object) equal} or {@linkplain
193   * Domain#sameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) the same type}. (The {@link List} is an ordered set.)</p>
194   *
195   * <p>This method returns determinate values.</p>
196   *
197   * <p>The elements of the returned {@link List} will be in the following (partial) order:</p>
198   *
199   * <ol>
200   *
201   * <li>The supplied {@link TypeMirror} precedes any other elements.</li>
202   *
203   * <li>{@linkplain Domain#subtype(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) Subtypes} precede supertypes.</li>
204   *
205   * <li>Non-interface types precede interface types.</li>
206   *
207   * </ol>
208   *
209   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
210   *
211   * @return a non-{@code null}, immutable {@link List} of the supertypes of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}
212   *
213   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
214   *
215   * @see #supertypes(TypeMirror, Predicate)
216   *
217   * @see Domain#directSupertypes(TypeMirror)
218   *
219   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10 Java Language Specification, section
220   * 4.10
221   *
222   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10.2 Java Language Specification, section
223   * 4.10.2
224   */
225  public final List<? extends TypeMirror> supertypes(final TypeMirror t) {
226    return this.supertypes(t, Types::returnTrue);
227  }
228
229  /**
230   * Returns a non-{@code null}, immutable {@link List} of the supertypes of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}, filtered
231   * using the supplied {@link Predicate}.
232   *
233   * <p>No element in the returned {@link List} will be {@code null}.</p>
234   *
235   * <p>Unless the supplied {@link Predicate} prevents it, the supplied {@link TypeMirror} will be the first element in
236   * the returned {@link List}. (The supertype relation is reflexive.)</p>
237   *
238   * <p>No two elements in the list will be {@linkplain Objects#equals(Object) equal} or {@linkplain
239   * Domain#sameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) the same type}. (The {@link List} is an ordered set.)</p>
240   *
241   * <p>This method returns determinate values.</p>
242   *
243   * <p>The elements of the returned {@link List} will be in the following (partial) order:</p>
244   *
245   * <ol>
246   *
247   * <li>{@linkplain Domain#subtype(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) Subtypes} precede supertypes.</li>
248   *
249   * <li>Non-interface types precede interface types.</li>
250   *
251   * </ol>
252   *
253   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
254   *
255   * @param p a {@link Predicate}; must not be {@code null}
256   *
257   * @return a non-{@code null}, immutable {@link List} of the supertypes of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}, filtered
258   * using the supplied {@link Predicate}
259   *
260   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code t} or {@code p} is {@code null}
261   *
262   * @see Domain#directSupertypes(TypeMirror)
263   *
264   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10 Java Language Specification, section
265   * 4.10
266   *
267   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10.2 Java Language Specification, section
268   * 4.10.2
269   */
270  public final List<? extends TypeMirror> supertypes(final TypeMirror t, final Predicate<? super TypeMirror> p) {
271    final ArrayList<TypeMirror> nonInterfaceTypes = new ArrayList<>(7); // arbitrary size
272    final ArrayList<TypeMirror> interfaceTypes = new ArrayList<>(17); // arbitrary size
273    supertypes(t, p, nonInterfaceTypes, interfaceTypes, newHashSet(13)); // arbitrary size
274    nonInterfaceTypes.trimToSize();
275    interfaceTypes.trimToSize();
276    return
277      concat(nonInterfaceTypes.stream(), // non-interface supertypes are already sorted from most-specific to least
278             interfaceTypes.stream().sorted(this.c)) // have to sort interfaces because you can extend them in any order
279      .toList();
280  }
281
282  private final void supertypes(final TypeMirror t,
283                                final Predicate<? super TypeMirror> p,
284                                final ArrayList<? super TypeMirror> nonInterfaceTypes,
285                                final ArrayList<? super TypeMirror> interfaceTypes,
286                                final Set<? super String> seen) {
287    if (seen.add(erasedName(t))) {
288      if (p.test(t)) {
289        if (isInterface(t)) {
290          interfaceTypes.add(t); // reflexive
291        } else {
292          nonInterfaceTypes.add(t); // reflexive
293        }
294      }
295      for (final TypeMirror directSupertype : domain.directSupertypes(t)) {
296        this.supertypes(directSupertype, p, nonInterfaceTypes, interfaceTypes, seen);
297      }
298    }
299  }
300
301
302  /*
303   * Static methods.
304   */
305
306
307  private static final String erasedName(final CharSequence cs) {
308    return cs instanceof String s ? s : cs.toString();
309  }
310
311  private static final String erasedName(final Element e) {
312    return e instanceof QualifiedNameable qn ? erasedName(qn) : erasedName(e.getSimpleName());
313  }
314
315  private static final String erasedName(final QualifiedNameable qn) {
316    final CharSequence n = qn.getQualifiedName();
317    return n == null || n.isEmpty() ? erasedName(qn.getSimpleName()) : erasedName(n);
318  }
319
320  /**
321   * Returns the <dfn>erased name</dfn> of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}.
322   *
323   * <p><dfn>Erased name</dfn> is not a term defined or used by the Java Language Specification. Its definition and
324   * contract follow.</p>
325   *
326   * <p>This method is primarily for use in calculating tiebreaking values for type-related {@linkplain
327   * Comparator#compare(Object, Object) comparison operations} where type erasure can be in effect. It is also useful in
328   * testing scenarios. Most users will never call this method.</p>
329   *
330   * <p>The erased name of a {@linkplain TypeKind#DECLARED declared type} of any kind is the erased name of its
331   * declaring {@link Element}.</p>
332   *
333   * <p>The erased name of an {@linkplain Element element} is its {@linkplain QualifiedNameable#getQualifiedName()
334   * qualified name}, if it has one, or its {@linkplain Element#getSimpleName() simple name} if it does not.</p>
335   *
336   * <p>The erased name of the {@linkplain TypeKind#BOOLEAN <code>boolean</code> primitive type} is {@code boolean}.</p>
337   *
338   * <p>The erased name of the {@linkplain TypeKind#BYTE <code>byte</code> primitive type} is {@code byte}.</p>
339   *
340   * <p>The erased name of the {@linkplain TypeKind#CHAR <code>char</code> primitive type} is {@code char}.</p>
341   *
342   * <p>The erased name of the {@linkplain TypeKind#DOUBLE <code>double</code> primitive type} is {@code double}.</p>
343   *
344   * <p>The erased name of the {@linkplain TypeKind#FLOAT <code>float</code> primitive type} is {@code float}.</p>
345   *
346   * <p>The erased name of the {@linkplain TypeKind#INT <code>int</code> primitive type} is {@code int}.</p>
347   *
348   * <p>The erased name of the {@linkplain TypeKind#LONG <code>long</code> primitive type} is {@code long}.</p>
349   *
350   * <p>The erased name of the {@linkplain TypeKind#SHORT <code>short</code> primitive type} is {@code short}.</p>
351   *
352   * <p>The erased name of the {@linkplain TypeKind#VOID <code>void</code> type} is {@code void}.</p>
353   *
354   * <p>The erased name of a {@linkplain TypeKind#TYPEVAR type variable} is the erased name of its declaring {@link
355   * javax.lang.model.element.TypeParameterElement TypeParameterElement}.</p>
356   *
357   * <p>The erased name of an {@linkplain TypeKind#INTERSECTION intersection type} is the {@link String} formed by
358   * joining the erased names of its {@linkplain IntersectionType#getBounds() bounds} with "{@code &}".</p>
359   *
360   * <p>The erased name of an {@linkplain TypeKind#ARRAY array type} is the {@link String} formed by concatenating the
361   * erased name of its {@linkplain ArrayType#getComponentType() component type} with "{@code []}".</p>
362   *
363   * <p>The erased name of any other {@link TypeMirror} is the return value of an invocation of its {@link
364   * Object#toString() toString()} method.</p>
365   *
366   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
367   *
368   * @return the <dfn>erased name</dfn> of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}; never {@code null}
369   *
370   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
371   */
372  public static final String erasedName(final TypeMirror t) {
373    return switch (t.getKind()) {
374    case ARRAY -> erasedName(((ArrayType)t).getComponentType()) + "[]";
375    case BOOLEAN -> "boolean";
376    case BYTE -> "byte";
377    case CHAR -> "char";
378    case DECLARED -> erasedName(((DeclaredType)t).asElement());
379    case DOUBLE -> "double";
380    case FLOAT -> "float";
381    case INT -> "int";
382    case INTERSECTION -> {
383      final StringJoiner sj = new java.util.StringJoiner("&");
384      for (final TypeMirror bound : ((IntersectionType)t).getBounds()) {
385        sj.add(erasedName(bound));
386      }
387      yield sj.toString();
388    }
389    case LONG -> "long";
390    case SHORT -> "short";
391    case TYPEVAR -> erasedName(((TypeVariable)t).asElement());
392    case VOID -> "void";
393    default -> t.toString();
394    };
395  }
396
397  private static final <T> boolean returnTrue(final T ignored) {
398    return true;
399  }
400
401
402  /*
403   * Inner and nested classes.
404   */
405
406
407  private final class SpecializationComparator implements Comparator<TypeMirror> {
408
409    private SpecializationComparator() {
410      super();
411    }
412
413    @Override
414    public final int compare(final TypeMirror t, final TypeMirror s) {
415      if (t == s) {
416        return 0;
417      } else if (t == null) {
418        return 1; // nulls right
419      } else if (s == null) {
420        return -1; // nulls right
421      } else if (domain.sameType(t, s)) {
422        return 0;
423      } else if (domain.subtype(t, s)) {
424        // t is a subtype of s; s is a proper supertype of t
425        return -1;
426      } else if (domain.subtype(s, t)) {
427        // s is a subtype of t; t is a proper supertype of s
428        return 1;
429      } else {
430        return erasedName(t).compareTo(erasedName(s));
431      }
432    }
433
434  }
435
436}
